channel.title: Windows 7 Freezing
channel.description:
So I have another problem with this brand new machine. Windows 7 freezes at for at least 5 minutes at least once every hour. My CPU usage never goes passed 2% while it freezes, and memory is a steady 2GB 100% of the time. As I'm typing this, it keeps freezing. I have no idea what's wrong so here's a hijackthis log in case that'll help. [code]Logfile of Trend Micro HijackThis v2.0.4 Scan saved at 2:13:27 PM, on 7/5/2010 Platform: Windows 7 (WinNT 6.00.3504) MSIE: Internet Explorer v8.00 (8.00.7600.16385) Boot mode: Normal
Running processes: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\Steam.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Pidgin\pidgin.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Motorola\MotoConnectService\MotoConnect.exe C:\Program Files\Logitech\Logitech WebCam Software\LWS.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Elaborate Bytes\VirtualCloneDrive\VCDDaemon.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Java\Java Update\jusched.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\iTunes\iTunesHelper.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Logishrd\LQCVFX\COCIManager.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\ARM\1.0\AdobeARM.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\plugin-container.exe C:\Program Files (x86)\Trend Micro\HiJackThis\HiJackThis.exe
R1 - HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Search Page = http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=54896 R0 - HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Start Page = http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=69157 R1 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Default_Page_URL = http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=69157 R1 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Default_Search_URL = http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=54896 R1 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Search Page = http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=54896 R0 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Start Page = http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=69157 R0 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Search,SearchAssistant = R0 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Search,CustomizeSearch = R0 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Local Page = C:\Windows\SysWOW64\blank.htm R1 - HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings,ProxyOverride = *.local R0 - HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Toolbar,LinksFolderName = O2 - BHO: AcroIEHelperStub - {18DF081C-E8AD-4283-A596-FA578C2EBDC3} - C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\Acrobat\ActiveX\AcroIEHelperShim.dll O2 - BHO: Groove GFS Browser Helper - {72853161-30C5-4D22-B7F9-0BBC1D38A37E} - C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Office\Office12\GrooveShellExtensions.dll O2 - {DBC80044-A445-435b-BC74-9C25C1C588A9} - C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\jp2ssv.dll O4 - HKLM\..\Run: [LogitechQuickCamRibbon] "C:\Program Files\Logitech\Logitech WebCam Software\LWS.exe" /hide O4 - HKLM\..\Run: [VirtualCloneDrive] "C:\Program Files (x86)\Elaborate Bytes\VirtualCloneDrive\VCDDaemon.exe" /s O4 - HKLM\..\Run: [StartCCC] "C:\Program Files (x86)\ATI Technologies\ATI.ACE\Core-Static\CLIStart.exe" MSRun O4 - item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:19, topic:347476”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=443854.msg3259216#msg3259216 date=1278369160]
I’m not trying to be a linux fanboy here, but windows just seems to do things like that sometimes. Every now and then you can find the problem and fix it, but I always found myself re-installing a fresh copy at least once a year if not two or three times. I’ve had the same install of Kubuntu since Jan 2006, even with two upgrades a year and no major problems.

So the only advice I can give is to reinstall Windows, and get used to it.
[/quote]Or… Download xp.[/quote]
No. Be quiet.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:347476”]I’m not trying to be a linux fanboy here, but windows just seems to do things like that sometimes. Every now and then you can find the problem and fix it, but I always found myself re-installing a fresh copy at least once a year if not two or three times. I’ve had the same install of Kubuntu since Jan 2006, even with two upgrades a year and no major problems.

So the only advice I can give is to reinstall Windows, and get used to it. :)[/quote]Or… Download xp.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

ZeroFreeze:

Did you upgrade from vista? Always good to do a clean, from-scratch installation on a new/empty HDD.

Seems the HDD is failing, called WD and new one is on it’s way.
And what the fuck is that dragonfurr

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:1, topic:347476”]So I have another problem with this brand new machine. Windows 7 freezes at for at least 5 minutes at least once every hour. My CPU usage never goes passed 2% while it freezes, and memory is a steady 2GB 100% of the time.
As I’m typing this, it keeps freezing.
I have no idea what’s wrong so here’s a hijackthis log in case that’ll help.[/quote]

Holic:

Windows 7 . . . memory is a steady 2GB 100% of the time.

Holic:

Windows 7 . . . steady 2GB

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

Did you upgrade from vista? Always good to do a clean, from-scratch installation on a new/empty HDD.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

I had the same (sort of) symptoms. I had two Seagate Barracuda drives in a RAID array which seemed to be spinning up at the same time as my OS crashed (both Win 7 and Fedora). Removed the hard drives and the problem went away.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:13, topic:347476”]have you got any external storage connected? what’s using your usb slots?[/quote]nope. my mouse, webcam, printer and ipod cord are the only things connected

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

have you got any external storage connected? what’s using your usb slots?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Rictoo:

Might be an IRQ conflict. Check dmesg.

please elaborate ric2

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Might be an IRQ conflict. Check dmesg.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:9, topic:347476”]I’ve installed Ubuntu 10.04, still freezes every now and again.
Must be a hardware issue, memtest says no issues with my memory and everything seems to be setup correctly. What now? :([/quote]have you checked temperatures? it might just be overheating, that’s an issue i had not too long ago

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I’ve installed Ubuntu 10.04, still freezes every now and again.
Must be a hardware issue, memtest says no issues with my memory and everything seems to be setup correctly. What now?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

You did something wrong lol. I use W7 only cause most of the stuff I use works with it. I work on Macs and can live with them, but there are a lot of programs I can’t run. Linux is my favorite but at the same time I can do almost nothing on it =/

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:347476”]I’m not trying to be a linux fanboy here, but windows just seems to do things like that sometimes. Every now and then you can find the problem and fix it, but I always found myself re-installing a fresh copy at least once a year if not two or three times. I’ve had the same install of Kubuntu since Jan 2006, even with two upgrades a year and no major problems.

So the only advice I can give is to reinstall Windows, and get used to it. :)[/quote]

I had kubuntu installed for half an hour and it crashed on me, 4 times. I re-installed windows 7 ontop of it, hasn’t crashed since.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m not trying to be a linux fanboy here, but windows just seems to do things like that sometimes. Every now and then you can find the problem and fix it, but I always found myself re-installing a fresh copy at least once a year if not two or three times. I’ve had the same install of Kubuntu since Jan 2006, even with two upgrades a year and no major problems.

So the only advice I can give is to reinstall Windows, and get used to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yeah. Never figured out what it was, but after formatting and reinstalling it everything is perfect.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:3, topic:347476”]I had the same experience the first time I installed W7, it would freeze up from time to time, if I typed single letters in the start menu search box things would crash, etc. Did you by chance upgrade to W7 from Vista? That’s what I did when it was like that :x So I did a clean install of the 64 bit version and it works great now. No freezing/crashing anything

If the computer is new, you can’t have that much stuff, just back it up and reinstall a clean version.[/quote]
I could just reinstall it, it’s just backing up 600GB of stuff is going to be a pain, let alone redownloading/reinstalling my games and applications.
It was a fresh install and what you’ve both described is exactly what’s going on with me.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

I had the same experience the first time I installed W7, it would freeze up from time to time, if I typed single letters in the start menu search box things would crash, etc. Did you by chance upgrade to W7 from Vista? That’s what I did when it was like that :x So I did a clean install of the 64 bit version and it works great now. No freezing/crashing anything

If the computer is new, you can’t have that much stuff, just back it up and reinstall a clean version.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 Freezing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Reinstall? The first W7 install I had sucked. For some reason, anything typed into an Explorer search bar took AGES. Even things like populating the Add/Remove windows with programs. Most Control Panel sections were the same way.

I recently reconfigured all my computers in my room. Complete format, brand new installs of W7, OSX 10.6.4, and ADRHEL 5.4.

Everything works like a charm, even W7 is much better than I thought it ever was.

Read full topic
